fields.description:
In the new view of JSD issues attachments are added as comments. It would be great to have the "attachments section" showing all issue attachments like issues in Jira Software have:

!print.png|width=374,height=226!

h3. Workaround
Use the old issue view instead. It can be disabled from Your profile and settings > Settings and toggle the switch for the [New Jira issue view|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/changes-to-issues-in-the-new-issue-view/].
The new issue view is permanently on for all business boards and next-gen software projects.
fields.summary: Show attachments section in the new issue view (Jira Core and Service Desk issues)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have an issue that was moved from Service Desk type to Software and a user shares this issue, Jira will send a notification to site-admin to grant access to Jira Service Desk instead of Jira Software

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue on a Service Desk project
# Move this issue to a Software project
# Ask to a user to share this issue with a user *without SD access*

h3. Expected Results
Jira should send an invite request for Jira Software

h3. Actual Results
Jira is sending an invite request for the original project

h3. Workaround
No workaround available at the moment
fields.summary: Sharing an issue that was moved to a different project, sends an invite for the original project type

fields.description: Visual info on the top right of the backlog. I always want these to be quick filters buttons like the team member icons to their left.  !image-2019-11-15-08-57-51-424.png!
fields.summary: As a TPM, I want to filter by the todo(grey)/in progress(blue)/done(gree) counters at the top right of the backlog, so that I can quick see all work in each stage.

fields.description: We use a large 50+ inch screen but the amount of white space to the right of  "recently updated" is enormous and wasted. Dynamically filling the space with team member filter icons would save a huge amount of time and effort in switching users at standup. !image-2019-11-15-08-48-58-898.png|width=2104,height=160!
fields.summary: As a TPM, I want see team members icons to dynamically fill the white space on the top of the backlog, so that I don't have to click +4 and check boxes during standup.

fields.description: The public instance should have a flag in comments "Inappropriate Comment" which removes those comments instead of manually delete the comments.
fields.summary: Public instance should have flag in comments "Inappropriate Comment"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Slack integration fails when issue titles contain multiple HTML tags
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new issue with multiple HTML tag in the issue description:
 !image-2019-11-15-12-06-38-230.png|thumbnail! 
 # Once saved, in the slack notification the below update is notified with extra tags:
 !image-2019-11-15-12-07-10-739.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The description set in Jira should come in the notification respecting the tags
h3. Actual Results
Extra tags(parenthesis) come up in the slack notification
h3. Workaround

No Workaround
fields.summary: Slack integration fails when issue titles contain multiple HTML tags

fields.description:
When the config value is changed which allows you to change the order in which the activity stream and comments stream appears, the comment box should change appropriately. 

Currently: if you have *jira.issue.actions.order* set to desc (most recent first) the user still needs to scroll past the comments before they can choose to add a comment themselves. 

Ideally: if the actions order is set to desc, then the comment input field should be at the top of the comments, and vice versa.
fields.summary: Comment Input Field location should follow jira.issue.actions.order (asc/desc)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the browser IE 11 and the New Issue View (UI), when trying to click on the *Add Watcher* button, the following error is displayed:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Internet Explorer 11
# Access any Jira instance making sure the New Issue View (Jira Labs) is enabled
# Access any issue
# Try to add a watcher to the issue rather than yourself through the *Add Watchers* button

h3. Expected Results
A field to browse users to be displayed and able to add others as watchers

h3. Actual Results
Error "Something's gone wrong" is displayed in the screen.

h3. Workaround
Use the old issue view.
You can disable the New Issue View for your user by clicking on your avatar on the bottom-left side of the screen, then Settings under Jira, scrolling down to the bottom of the page and through the toggle button, disable it.
fields.summary: Watcher functionality doesn't work with Internet Explorer 11 when using the New Issue View

fields.description:
When splitting a story, please add re-fetching so

a) the backlog is updated,

b) the story itself is updated, and

c) I can view the split story immediately.

Alternatively, please extend splitting functionality so I can edit more information from the original and new.
fields.summary: More options & refresh when splitting issue

fields.description: hello
fields.summary: Test suggestion

fields.description: It would be useful to filter the roadmap view based on tags
fields.summary: Tag filter option on roadmap view

fields.description:
As a Jira software user, I would like to have the ability to browse Jira users while submitting smart commits in Bitbucket Server.

The goal of this improvement request is to have the option to submit smart commits with reference to Jira users, for example:

If we add comments via smart commit with the message "Adalberto Schneider", Jira will read "Adalberto Schneider" as a Jira user, and if you select the user, it will redirect you to the user profile page.

Right now, while submitting a smart commit with the text ~email address, for example, ~aschneider@atlassian.com, if the email address matches the username, Jira renders it as a mention, allowing the user to submit that smart commit with a reference for that user in Jira.

However, the username is no longer customizable and it will be deprecated in the near future, this workaround works for old usernames where the email address matches the username, however, it is not working for new users where we don't know the username and it won't work at all when we fully deprecate the usernames.
fields.summary: Allow browsing Jira users in Bitbucket Cloud while integrating both applications via application link.

fields.description: just a test
fields.summary: just a test

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Post function "copy value from other field" does not work on the *create transition* for Description field when copying it from a text custom field
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to your project settings > Workflows >Edit > Click on the create transition > Post functions
 # Configure the Post function "copy value from other field", copying the text custom field to the Description:   !image-2019-11-12-15-22-45-098.png|width=564,height=169!                       
 # Save the workflow draft
 # Create an issue with any values in the text custom field

h3. Expected Results

when creating a issue, the custom field value is added to the issue description.
h3. Actual Results

The description is not set.
h3. Workaround

None at this moment.
fields.summary: Post function "copy value from other field" does not work on create transition for Description field

fields.description:
h3. Having the option to access the 'People' tab on the app would help better understand workloads before assigning tasks when working on mobile devices.  
h3. Hi [Jira|https://twitter.com/Jira]! We love your project management solution. Our company uses the People function on the web version to manage workloads before assigning more tasks. We believe a lot of companies will benefit from this feature on mobile! Please consider 👍[pic.twitter.com/q5FJsCoVUh|https://t.co/q5FJsCoVUh]
fields.summary: Option to access 'People' tab from mobile app

fields.description: Just a simple system to hide completed projects when they're done, rather than resorting to deleting them.
fields.summary: Archiving Projects

fields.description:
Currently there is no REST endpoint, accessible by Connect apps, that return a list of all sprints in the system.

Such a list is needed in cases where you let the user select a sprint and prepare a report based on it.

A possible workaround is to get a list of all boards in the system and traverse all boards to collect sprints. Which is very bad for UI responsiveness.

 

There is an endpoint for this and Jira uses it for Issue Navigator but it is not available for Connect apps:

/rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/picker?excludeCompleted=false&query=

An endpoint should be introduced or the endpoint above should be made available to Connect apps.
fields.summary: REST endpoint to get all sprints in the system

fields.description:
JIra's priority Japanese translation is very strange and difficult to use.
Japanese translation is now as follows.

Blocker ⇒　ブロッカー
Critical ⇒　重要
Major　 ⇒ 重度
Minor　⇒　軽度
Trivial ⇒ 最低

※ "最低" have another meaning like "worst","disgusting"....   

it means like:

Blocker ⇒ Blocker
Critical ⇒ Important
Major ⇒ Severe
Minor ⇒ Mild
Trivial ⇒ lowest

重要（Critical ） and  重度（Major）are quite similar Japanese,

I don't know which level is higher... 

 

I know if someone have the global authority could change ,
but I would like to ask you to consider updating the default.

As a suggestion：

Blocker ⇒ ブロッカー
Critical ⇒ クリティカル （or 緊急）
Major ⇒ 重要　（or 高）
Minor ⇒ 中度　 (or 中)
Trivial ⇒  軽度　（or 低）

Please consider it.
fields.summary: Japanese translation of priority

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Copying JIRA number includes "copy the link to this issue" text

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Please check the below screen recording:

 [^Copying Issue Key.mov] 

h3. Expected Results

Only the issue key should be copied when selecting the issue key

dd
h3. Actual Results

Below text is copied along with issue key:

xxx-xxxx Copy the link to this issue 
    
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Copying JIRA number includes "copy the link to this issue" text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User's, specifically Jira service desk customers' display names and icon are broken, and displaying username "qm:..." on issues.
This can be seen at the following:
* Reporter field on the issue
* Comments by reporter/request participants on the issue

The usernames are overlapping on other fields and texts on the ticket.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a service desk project, access any ticket
# Check "Reporter" or "Request participants" field and comments

h3. Expected Results
User display name and icon should be displayed correctly

h3. Actual Results
User display name and icon is broken and showing alphanumeric username that is overlapping on other contents of the ticket.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour.
fields.summary: Users' display name and icon broken on issue view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Cloud*. Using *Jira Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-70231].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

With the addition of the JQL function [issueLinkType|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-issuelinktypeIssuelinktype], Jira Cloud now has the ability to let users search by the issue link's Name, Outward Description, and/or Inward description. The problem with this is that by default the issue link type 'Blocks' also has an outward description by the same name 'blocks'. Since these are the same, you can't actually only get back results with that outward description. Instead you get back all issues with that link name, which includes both outward ('blocks') and inward ('is blocked by').
 By default only the Blocks link type has a description with the same value as the link Name. The suggested solution would be to have new Jira sites use a different change the outward link name from 'blocks' to something different such as 'blocking'.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link one issue to another with the blocks issue link type
 # Search JQL with:
{code:java}
issueLinkType = "blocks" 
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Would expect to only get back a single issue with that outward description of 'blocks'
h3. Actual Results

You actually will get back all the issues of that link name (both inward and outward description) because the term that is being searched here matches the link name.
h3. Workaround

You can edit the link descriptions so that they do not exactly match the name of the link type. For example you could change the outward link name from 'blocks' to something different such as 'blocking'. This would at least permit users to make these specific JQL searches based on the description and not the name. Changing the link type Name will not prevent JQL from returning the issues "Blocked by", only changing the *Outward description* will.
fields.summary: Issue Link names should be different from their descriptions

fields.description:
Currently, we can only set global permissions to either groups or Public.
There should be a way of setting it to *Any Logged-in User*.

This would make things easier for administrators since they wouldn't need to check default access groups for new users and add each of them there. 

h4. Workaround
Associate the groups that give access to Jira to the global permission
fields.summary: Ability to set global permissions to Any Logged-in User

fields.description:
While deleting the parent task and if parent task has sub-taks then it should give an error :

"Task is associated with sub-task. To delete parent task, please delete sub-task first and then parent task"
fields.summary: Error message improvement while performing bulk operation

fields.description:
create alarms in tasks with deadlines.

It would be great to have an alarm on the very important task to remember the team how much days/hours until deadline.
fields.summary: Alarms for the tasks

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if a custom field is used specifically only in a project, the Project Admin will still not be able to configure it and require *Administer Jira* global permission to configure custom field.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the Project Admin to configure the custom field if it's only used in a single project.
fields.summary: Ability to configure custom field as a Project Admin

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The single select type custom field doesn't retain the alphabetical order that is used to store values/options upon creation in the new issue view only. In the old issue view, it works fine as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field (single select type)
# Add some values in alphabetical order.
# Add the field to issue view screen.
# Pull an issue to show the field in the new issue view.

h3. Expected Results
* The new field shows options in alphabetical order.

h3. Actual Results
* The new field show values in random order.

h3. Workaround

Use the old issue view.
fields.summary: Custom field (single select type) does not retain alphabetical order in new issue view

fields.description:
The user is copying and pasting from their screen running our web-based SaaS software, which is coded in JAVA and runs on LINUX SQL database. 
 
When users of our software have a problem, they copy and paste from their screen to show us where they are having trouble. Users are able to copy and paste what they want to show us from their screen from our software into email and Happy Fox with no problem. However, that doesn’t work in Jira. 
 
Essentially, it would be much more productive if clients could copy and paste images within Jira without having to use the same software.
fields.summary: Copy and Paste - unable to view client image

fields.description:
h3. Current behavior

Currently, the Custom Fields will be using the size of the screen you are viewing the Edit Issue screen

  !Screen Shot 2019-11-08 at 3.11.57 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Expected behavior 
It would be good to have the availability to resize the fields from the edit screen.
fields.summary: Ability to edit the width from fields and custom fields in edit screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Control-K in Mac does not Delete the text between the insertion point and the end of the line or paragraph.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any text field like comments, description and type some text.
# Control-K should "Delete the text between the insertion point and the end of the line or paragraph." This is according to Apple's documentation: https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201236
 !Screenshot 2019-11-08 at 16.46.07.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Control-K should delete the text between the insertion point and the end of the line or paragraph.

h3. Actual Results
Control-K prompts the user to add a link. It works the same way Command-K should work.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Control-K in Mac does not Delete the text between the insertion point and the end of the line or paragraph.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The post function to update the field "Time Spent", doesnot update the value in the issue after transition.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit the workflow
# Add Post Function on Create Issue transition / or any transition
# Update Issue Field: Time Spent and value: 1m
# Publish
# Create Issue
# Go to Reports > Time Tracking Report > Next

h3. Expected Results
Time Spent column updated with value

h3. Actual Results
Time Spent column is empty

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The post function to update the field "Time Spent", doesnot update the value in the issue after transition.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you load pages (for example, the new view issue page, or kanban board) in Jira for the first time as a non-English user, the page displays English content briefly before becoming translated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set your language to something other than English
 # Load any issue (using the new issue view)

h3. Expected Results

The text appears in the user's non-English language
h3. Actual Results

Some content is initially displayed in English before rendering in the correct language.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Initially loading most pages in Jira using a non-English language shows a flash of English content before being translated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer's mentioned name appears as Public Name from profile and visibility page instead of the stipulated Full Name for other org admin users including himself even when the . [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility] *Full Name* is set to *Who can see this > <Organisation>*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a public JSD project
 # Log in as a managed account user 
 # Set profile and visibility as below 
 ## Full Name visible to same "Organisation" users
 ## Public Name is different and set to be visible to "Anyone"

h3. Expected Results

Organisation members comment mentioning you the managed account user and you open the issue view and still appears fine. The notification icon on the left tab (menu tab) shows you appear as the correct full name
h3. Actual Results

Organisation members comment mentioning you the managed account user and you open the issue view and still appears fine. However opening the notification icon on the left tab (menu tab) shows you appear as the public name instead of full name
h3. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: Org Admin users see Public Name instead Full Name at Notification Panel on UI's Left Tab

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JQL changed to clause not working properly when having the same status name in a Classic and Next-Gen project. When using a query, for example
{code}status CHANGED TO QA{code}
It will return only results regarding one project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Classic Project and add a custom status in the Workflow, for example, QA;
# Create a Next-Gen project and create a status with the same name;
# Create one issue in each project and transition them to QA status;
# Run the query above.

h3. Expected Results
Issues from all projects will be returned.

h3. Actual Results
The JQL only returns issues from one project.

h3. Workaround

Rename one of the statuses to a different name and use both in the JQL query.
fields.summary: JQL changed to clause not working properly when having the same status name in a Classic and Next-Gen project

fields.description:
As an administrator, I need to be able to manage the filter subscriptions from other users, or, at least, be able to delete the filter subscription.

The main reason for that is because when a user is no longer part of the instance (no longer has access), the filter subscription cannot be deleted and only creating a new filter will delete that subscription.

For the management perspective, it is not ideal since we don't have a way to know if the filter has a subscription or not or to who it is reporting the issues from the filter and, if the user leaves the company and no longer has access, makes impossible to change the owner or delete the subscription.

This is also time-consuming to recreate filters when we have a high number of filters with filter subscriptions to simply delete the filter subscriptions.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to manage filter subscriptions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Date time custom field keep the user timezone that raised the ticket in the new issue view but changes to the timezone of the user who is viewing the ticket in the old issue view. If you change your timezone back to the same as the ticket was created, both views show the same information.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a date time custom field;
# Add to the screen and edit the field in the *new issue view*;
# Change your personal timezone;
# Check both views again.

h3. Expected Results

The date time picker custom field shows according to the timezone of the user who is viewing the ticket.

h3. Actual Results

The date time picker custom field shows the timezone of the user who raised the ticket in the new issue view, but shows the current timezone of the user viewing the ticket in the old view.

New issue view:
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-07 at 17.09.16.png|thumbnail! 

Old issue view:
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-07 at 17.09.31.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use the old view.
fields.summary: Date time custom field keep user timezone in new issue view, but not in old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, even if attachments are deleted from issues/projects, they will remain in the recent uploads.

That may be a problem in organisations, specially if the uploads contain legal documents.

h3. Suggestion

Provide the ability for administrators to manage other user's recent uploads, including the ability of deleting them, or request deletion.
fields.summary: Ability to administer users' recent uploads

fields.description:
The use case is to close tasks automatically when that tasks fixed-version has been deployed in Bitbucket.

Jira appears to already have knowledge about this state.
fields.summary: Add a workflow trigger on bitbucket deployments

fields.description: h3. Issue Summary When accessing activity stream from Jira dashboard, the hover over for relative date such as "3 days ago" shows "LLL" when the mouse hovers on the date. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create an activity gadget from the dashboard. # Access the activity and hover on the relative date # Noticed that the title becomes "LLL" from the mouse hover over on the relative date. {code} 3 days ago {code} h3. Expected Results The activity stream shows the exact date from the mouse hover over. h3. Actual Results "LLL" was shown from the mouse hover over rather than the actual date h3. Workaround Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Hovering over a relative date from activity stream gadget shows "LLL" instead of the actual date.

fields.description:
After closing a sprint in Jira, the sprint report switches to a dynamic state: it shows the state of the sprint and tickets in the sprint at the moment the sprint was closed.

The problem, however, is that it is *not* clear if and when a sprint report became static.

Our product owners use this view during the sprint to communicate the status of issues to the stakeholders, and it is confusing to them that "suddenly" their overview becomes static.

*Request:*

Is it possible to:
 * Make it clear to the user that a sprint report became static after closing the sprint

OR 
 * Make it possible to switch between a static view (as it currently is) and a dynamic view (which shows the actual statuses of the tickets in the overview)

OR 
 * Add an extra column to the report displaying the current ticket status
fields.summary: Clarify that and when a sprint report became static

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers would like to be able to search in Jira based on the User Profile Attributes (Department, Organization, Location/Based in, etc) set on their Users' Profiles

These values are either set by Atlassian Access SCIM/User Provisioning or Users have manually populated their own profile details

h3. Suggested Solution
Expose the Atlassian account User Attributes or sync the attributes into Jira so that they can be search via JQL 

h3. Why this is important
This information could be used for filtering reports based on Department/Organization/Location/etc
 
h3. Workaround 
On the Issues raised, use Components, Custom Fields, or Labels to define these values which can then be searched for via JQL
fields.summary: JQL Search Atlassian account User Profile Attributes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Not able to see/scroll all the screens under field configuration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new custom field.
# Associate this field to about 20 screens.
# Access the project settings > *Fields*
# Click on screens' link

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to see/scroll over all screens

h3. Actual Results
The pop up that appears has a fixed height and we can't scroll the other screens.
 !screen.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround
Access the field configuration under custom fields, so the users can see all the screens.
{quote}
# Select the Jira icon (top left corner) > Jira settings > Issues.
# Under FIELDS, select Custom Fields.
{quote}
fields.summary: Not able to see/scroll all the screens under field configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Editing comments is slow on the New Issue View.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue in the New Issue View.
# Click on Edit of a comment
# As fast as you start typing the comment, it will be lagged

h3. Expected Results
It should not have any lag on it.

h3. Actual Results
It's lagged to edit comments.

h3. Workaround
In the Old Issue View editing comments works fine.
fields.summary: Typing Comments in the New Issue View while editing them is Lagged

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
For text-based JQL searches, if "-a" is included at the end of the string, Jira looks at this as a wildcard {*} rather than a string which then gives more results than it should.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 Issues in Jira, one having the *Summary* as "testing_46565-1-a" and the other as "testing_46565-1-b".
# Do a JQL search on that *Summary* field for -a ({{summary ~ "\"testing_46565-1-a\""}})

h3. Expected Results
I would expect the results to be all matches with the "testing_46565-1-a" *Summary*

 !Issue_navigator_-_b.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The results include all Issues with a similar *Summary* and looks at the "*-a*" as a wildcard, essentially making the JQL {{summary ~ "\"testing_46565-1*\""}}.

 !Issue_navigator_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
As a workaround, you can change the *Indexing language* language in the General settings to "Other" which may be related to the stemming of the word "a".

 !Edit_Jira_Configuration_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JQL search is treating the letter a as a wildcard

fields.description:
Often due to network challenges it is not possible to access and view issues in Jira.

Building a technology that allows usage of Jira data offline - backup / mirroring / desktop client.
fields.summary: Capability to use Jira Cloud Offline

fields.description: JIRA should allow for virus scanning of attachments, which could then be rejected if viruses were found.
fields.summary: Virus scan attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Push notifications via automation rules(JSD) are delayed on Android

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an automation rule to alert a user when an issue is created.
# Create a test ticket.

h3. Expected Results
* User should receive a push notification related to the mention comment.

h3. Actual Results
* The notifications are delayed
* Sometimes the user needs to force the notifications to reload in order to see the notification

h3. Notes
* On iOS 13.1.3 it worked just fine
* Sometimes the notifications were not delivered at all on Android
 
h3. Workaround
Users can rely on the notification scheme instead and check the notifications via email.
fields.summary: Push notifications for mentions via automation rules(JSD) are delayed on Android

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Where is my field?* feature is failing to load the field information in the first time you try and when you try it for the second time, it will work fine.

When it fails for the first time and you're accessing it using the *Edit* > *Configure Fields* > *Where is my field?* option, the screen will keep greyed out and you will need to reload the page.

You can check this behavior in the following video.

*  [^where_is_my_field.mov] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Access a software issue using the old issue view.
# Go to *Edit* > *Configure Fields* > *Where is my field?* and select any field.
# The screen will grey out and it's necessary to reload.
# Now access this feature using *Admin* > *Where is my field?* and search for a field.
# The first time will fail, try it again.
# The result will be displayed, now access it using the *Edit* > *Configure Fields* > *Where is my field?* and select any field.
# The information will be displayed properly.

h3. Expected Results

The feature should return the information for the first time you search for it.

h3. Actual Results

The first time you search for a field using the *Where is my field? is failing.

h3. Workaround

Use the *Where is my field?* inside the *Admin*.
fields.summary: The Where is my field? feature is failing to load the field information.
Using a filter which contains the project category in the query on the Jira Issues Calendar Gadget, will not filter correctly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding a customer account as a single user to the notification scheme throws a 500 error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a customer account;
# Go to the notification scheme and try to add that account as a single user to any event.

h3. Expected Results

An error saying that customer accounts can't be added to the notification is shown.

h3. Actual Results

A 500 error is thrown, with no more explanations of the error.
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-04 at 16.50.32.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Adding customer accounts to the notification scheme throws a 500 error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Extra space after the final pipe of a table row, causes the table to broke in the new issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a CSV file with the issue description, issue type and issue summary;
 # Create a table in the issue description. Make sure to add extra space after the final pipe of the table row;
 # Import the CSV file;

h3. Expected Results
The table in the description will render as expected in the new issue view.

h3. Actual Results
The table will be broken.

CSV files for testing:
 [^table_erros.csv]  [^table_no_erros.csv] 

h3. Workaround
Editing the CSV files where there's the extra space after the table row pipe.
fields.summary: Importing an issue having an extra space after the pipe of a table row in the description of an issue, causes the table to broke in the new issue view
Ability to disable the "Configure fields" button in the old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per issue summary above, the releases Panel disappears permanently if placed into hidden fields column issue layout.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate a dummy DVCS repository to your Cloud instance.
# Create a JIRA Software project.
# Now go to the issue layout screen. The 'Releases panel' should be there.
# Move the 'Releases panel' into the hidden field column.
# Save changes. Refresh the page.
# The 'Releases panel' is now gone.

h3. Expected Results
'Releases panel' stays in the hidden field. User can add the panel back to the issue layout anytime.

h3. Actual Results
'Releases panel' field disappears permanently. You can no longer add it back to the issue layout so it will no longer show on the JIRA ticket.

h3. Workaround
You will need to swap to another new issue type screen scheme. That will make the 'Releases panel' appear again. Should it be moved to the hidden field, however, it will disappear again.

{panel:title=Update 20 Nov 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3399ff|titleBGColor=#3399ff|bgColor=#e0e0e0}
The workaround provided will not necessarily work because you specifically need to swap the *Screen Scheme* with another one that has the *Releases panel* field still available in the *Issue layout*.

{panel}
fields.summary: 'Releases panel' disappears permanently if placed into hidden fields column issue layout

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to add a group using a long name and with special characters to a filter subscription, the user gets a 500 error
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter in Jira
 # Create a user group including some special characters and with a long name, like "This is a very long name for a Jira group - just testing it P&D"
 # Add users to the group
 # Go back to Jira and click the magnifier icon at the left of the screen and click *Filters*
 # Next to the filter's name, click *more(...) > Manage subscriptions*
 # Click the button *Add subscription*
 ## In *Recipients*, select the group *This is a very long name for a Jira group - just testing it P&D*
 # Click *Subscribe*

h3. Expected Results

The screen shows the group subscribed to the filter
h3. Actual Results

A 500 error is displayed

!Screen Shot 2019-11-01 at 9.16.27 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Since groups cannot be renamed, create a new group which the name doesn't include special characters, add the users of the problematic group to this new group and use this group for the filter subscription
fields.summary: Groups including special characters causes 500 errors in the filter subscription

fields.description:
Currently on Jira Cloud, if you order adds components to an issue, it'll keep displaying on alphabetic order. 

h3. Improvement
Allow users to choose the way the Component content will be ordered:
* Alphabetic
* According to the sequence when each component was added
* Etc
fields.summary: Allow Components field to choose the what order it'll be exported on a CSV file

fields.description:
I noticed that releases in [this project|[https://jira.atlassian.com/projects/JRACLOUD?selectedItem=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:release-page&status=released]] stopped updating 31/Mar/2017 however there are ton's of new bugs, suggestions, etc..  Where can we find release notes of Cloud Updates now? Not the marketing slipsheet but the actual issues that are part of the release!

As a customer of your product we are on a shared Agile platform and we need to know what you change and when you change it as it will affect our users and our business. We use your platform to manage this exact process and we chose Jira for it's power to help automate giving this type of information to our stakeholders and users. why don't you?
fields.summary: I suggest you use your own product with more efficiency.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, you can check the amount of storage you are using in Jira/Confluence.

But, when it gets closer to the limit, it is necessary to take decisions on what to remove from the instance.

h3. Suggestion

Provide admins the ability of managing/viewing all the present files attached to issues in the instance. There could be a functionality to list the following:
* Files and their size;
* File extensions;
* Amount of files per project.
fields.summary: Ability to manage existing attachments in the instance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When displaying a field for select-list (multi-choice) in new issue view, it doesn't show the same order from the field configuration which configured for the edit options.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a multi-choice select list custom field on Jira
 # Add that custom field to a screen.
# Go to the project where that screen is placed and with the new issue view enabled, try to edit that custom field option by selecting Configure and select Edit option
# From *Edit Options for Custom Field* page, order the sequence for the edit option. 
# Access the ticket with the custom field from old issue view and new issue view to identifying the differences of the order.

h3. Expected Results
* The select list show the same order from the edit option on new issue view

h3. Actual Results
* Seeing the inconsistency of the order from old/new issue view

h3. Workaround

* Edit the field from old issue view
fields.summary: Single and Multi-choice select list does not show the same order of options in New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The checkbox type custom field does not retain the order of the options in the issue view. This happens when more values are added after the initial setup of the custom field. In the issue view, it keeps showing the original order. Even if the options are re-arranged in the correct order and saved. It shows the correct order though while creating new issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a next-gen software project.
# Go to project settings and choose an issue type.
# Create a new custom field of checkbox type.
# Enter values in alphabetical order.
# Save the changes.
# Create an issue of this issue type and it will show the field values in the saved order.
# Go to project settings and choose the same issue type. Add a few more values in the end and drag-drop them in the correct order.
# Reload the previously created issue. It will still show the values in previously saved order with new values at the end.
# Create another issue, it will show the correct order during creation.


h3. Expected Results
* Issue view shows the values in the correct order for old/new issues.

h3. Actual Results
* Issue view shows the values in the originally saved order 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Checkbox type custom field in the next-gen project doesn't retain order

fields.description: The Jira Cloud mobile app allows you to complete sprints, add issues to versions & create versions, but not create or deploy a release.
fields.summary: Release functionality in Mobile app (iOS and Android)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When seeing the option order of a custom field in the new issue view, it does not reflect the order in the field configuration.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a custom field with some options;
* Put them in a different order from the one you created;
* Check the field in the new issue view.

h3. Expected Results

The order will be reflected.
!field-configuration.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

It orders differently.
!new-issue-view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

The old issue view will reflect the correct order.
fields.summary: New Issue View does not reflect field options order

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Smart Linking is currently not working with JIRA multi-line fields. This is affecting new JIRA issue view only.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Try to copy paste a JIRA ticket URL into a multi line field.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA ticket links like https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/browse/AT2-76032 should render into <Title> <issue-key>

h3. Actual Results
Only the URL is showing, no rendering is triggered.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Smart Linking not working on Jira multi-line fields

fields.description:
When I look at a PR in Bitbucket the order of reviewers starts with all of the reviewers who already have approved a PR. When I look at the PR tab of the Developer Modal in a Jira ticket, the order does not start with the reviewers who have already approved the PR. This has led to me assuming that a ticket didn't have enough approvals when it did. 

Steps to recreate:

View a Jira ticket with a pull request and several approvals. 

Check the Developer/Pull Request modal

Notice that the order of reviewers in the reviewer column does not start with people who have approved the PR

Compare with how the reviewer list appears in Bitbucket
fields.summary: Order Pull request approvals to show approvals first

fields.description:
h2. Current behavior

With the recent changes on Jira Cloud, new users are now being redirected to Your Work page instead of the Dashboard. Previously this has changed to Projects and then it was switched back to Dashboards again.
h2. Suggestion

Make the Dashboard as the default landing page for old and new users in Jira or add a checkbox for the admin to select what is the best option for their users.
h2. Why this is important?

New users are not working on anything, so when they first log in, they will see nothing and most of the time, they want to see the gadgets that are more organized to see what is happening on the projects they are working on.
fields.summary: Set Dashboard as the default landing page for new users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's not possible to bulk change the Filters/Dashboards owner and the user will have to transfer the ownership 1 Filter/Dashboard at a time.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to bulk transfer ownership of Filters/Dashboards.
fields.summary: Bulk change Filters/Dashboards owner

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user generates a Jira backup with attachments, there's a 48 hours cooldown period where users can't generate another backup with attachments. They are allowed to generate a backup without attachments as this type of backup doesn't have any timer. However, this will reset the backup timer for the Jira backup with attachments.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate a Jira backup with attachments (48 hours timer)
 # After 24 hours, the timer should be reduced to 24 hours left. 
 # Now, generate a backup without attachments.
 # The timer for backup with attachments is reset back to 48 hours.

h3. Expected Results
* The backup without attachments should not reset the timer for backup with attachments.

h3. Actual Results
* The backup without attachments resets the timer for backup with attachments.

h3. Workaround
None.
fields.summary: No attachment backup will reset the timer to 48 hours if there is existing timer due to backup with attachments previously

fields.description:
Currently, using JQL users can search for:
* openSprint()
* closedSprints()
* futureSprints()

As Jira stores a list of all sprints an issue was part of, it's not possible to get results only with Open Sprints to create reports. If you try to exclude the closed sprints, it'll remove issues with more then one sprint value even though the issue is part if an open sprint. 

h3. Improvement:
Allow users to get on JQL results only the Open Sprints value on a specific field so it can be used on Jira reports
fields.summary: Ability to get results only with Open Sprints

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-69819].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, the "User email visibility" setting affects webhooks by determining whether or not user emails are sent with the message body. However, the behavior is inconsistent as certain webhook actions will include email addresses, while others won't.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility] and set the visibility of your email address to your organization (managed accounts);
 # Configure webhooks to trigger on "Issue created" and "Comment created" (You can use the site [https://www.webhookapp.com|https://www.webhookapp.com/] for testing);
 # Go to Jira and create an issue;
 # Comment on any issue.

h3. Expected Results

The message body won't show your e-mail address.
h3. Actual Results

In the "Issue created" request, the "emailAddress:" content under "user" is hidden in the message body, but it still shows under "assignee", "creator" and "reporter", while in the "Comment created" request the "emailAddress:" is hidden.
h3. Notes

Have not tested all potential webhook events for this behavior.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: User email visibility is inconsistent with Webhooks

fields.description: According to [this page|[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/overview-of-permissions-in-next-gen-projects-959283605.html]], you have to be an admin to add others as watchers in next-gen projects. Please allow members to at least add other people as watchers to issues in next-gen projects. I'm less concerned about removing other people, though that would be nice too and seems to be included in the current "manage watchers" permission.
fields.summary: Allow members of next-gen projects to manage watchers

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The option to rank to top/rank to bottom is currently not available on the new issue view

h3. Suggested Solution
Bring back the option to Rank directly from the issue view
 !image-2019-10-30-23-20-11-530.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround 
Use the old issue view
fields.summary: Please include 'Rank to Top' in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the value of a custom field is not provided during a transition and a condition requires this value to be provided, the value of another custom field gets cleared.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field *Developers* of type *User Picker (multiple users)* and place this field in a screen called *Develop*
 !Screenshot 2019-10-30 at 3.48.17 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Create another custom field of type Text Field (multi-line) *Testers text* and place this and *Developers* field in a screen called *testers*
 !Screenshot 2019-10-30 at 3.52.19 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Add the screen *Develop* in a transition in the workflow and add a *field is required* validator for the *Developers* field.
 !Screenshot 2019-10-30 at 3.55.55 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Add the screen *testers* to a following transition with a validator that the field *Testers text* is required.
 !Screenshot 2019-10-30 at 3.58.28 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Create an issue and perform the first transition by providing a value in *Developers* field.
# Perform the next transition. When the screen appears, skip providing a value in *Testers text* field.

h3. Expected Results
Only a warning as _Testers Text is required_ should appear.
h3. Actual Results
The warning appears and the value previously provided in *Developers* field gets cleared.
 !Screenshot 2019-10-30 at 4.01.39 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

At present, the only option is to not skip providing the value OR re-adding the values in the *Developers* field.
fields.summary: User Picker custom field value gets cleared if value of another custom field is not provided in next transition

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Options sorting does not follow the order that was being set through the Custom Field Configuration

h3. Steps to Replicate
# Create Radio Custom Field with Options in a specific order
# Associate the Custom Field to a Screen 
# View the Field Options in New Issue View

h3. Expected Result
Options follow the specific sorting from the custom field configuration
*Custom Field Configuration*
 !Screenshot 2019-10-30 at 3.57.54 PM.png|thumbnail!  

*Old Issue View*
 !Screenshot 2019-10-30 at 3.58.47 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Result
Options are not sorted correctly
*New Issue View*
 !Screenshot 2019-10-30 at 3.59.36 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
- Switching back to the old view solves this problem
fields.summary: Radio Button field options does not follow correct sorting

fields.description:
h3. Suggestions
Ability to specify the pixel size for image
Ability to add border or shadow
fields.summary: Ability to resize Image attachments, add border and shadows

fields.description:
h4. Problem Description

The new issue view layout has moved many custom fields to the right panel, such as:

* Any fields which are under tabs 
* Option type fields
* Single-line text type fields

This panel is more narrow, it drastically reduced the space for those fields

h4. Proposed solution

It would be really nice if users be provided with the ability to *re-size* both panels, allowing enlarge the width of the right panel accordingly. Something like this (of course, blue lines are just for reference :)):
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

For sure, this would have some thresholds on how much you can resize, but it would really help to better focus on the right information depending on how you use the issue view.

h4. Why is this important?

Many customers may have a different view of Jira's usage. If your use case of Jira is more for a "form" where fields are more important than comments and the text content. This would help a lot. Whoever works with Jira like this, with the new issue view, spend way more time looking into a minor part of the screen that has around 33% only of its space, while the rest which is not being focused has around 66%.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want custom fields larger in the new issue view

fields.description:
When using JQL, it returns all issues which match the query, and it's not possible to limit the results of the search.

As a Jira user, I want the JQL queries to return a limited number of issues from a search, like SQL LIMIT or TOP statements work.

This would be very valuable when you want to get e.g. the 10 highest ranked stories.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want to be able to set a limit for JQL search results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you try to add an attachment while logging work, Jira will freeze and you will need either to reload the page or close it and open again.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue
 # Click in the "..."
 # Select the option "Log Work"
 # Add time to log
 # Try to add an attachment to the description field

h3. Expected Results
Jira adds the attachments to the issue, with the logged work when you click in to save.

h3. Actual Results
Jira freezes and it's not possible to neither save or cancel the addition.
 [^Bug Attachment.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
The workaround would be to add the attachment before or after the log work.
fields.summary: Adding Attachment while Logging Work Freezes the Page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Changing the date on the Hungarian language doesn't work in the old issue view as the month in Hungarian has 4 characters (o+k+t+.) which doesn't work if you have a date picker format with dd/MMM/yy

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access your personal settings and change your language to *Magyar*
 # Create a custom date time picker and tried to change the date from the old issue view.
# Noticed that there's an error from the date-time picker,
# If you change the language to English, the issue doesn't persist.
# Issue doesn't persist from *new issue view*

h3. Expected Results

The date is changed accordingly from the date-time picker.

h3. Actual Results

The below error message is thrown from the issue view:
{code}
Érvenytelen dátumformátum. A dátumot "dd/MMM/yy h:mm a" formában adja meg.{code}
h3. Workaround

# Use English as the default language or toggle to New Issue View to set the date from the date-time picker field.
fields.summary: Date picker does not work if the language used is Hungarian from old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in the old issue view have the options to reorder the comments. It will be best for this feature apply for new issue view too.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the option to reorder asc/desc the comments.

h3. Why this is important
Easier for the user to put the latest comment down or up the list.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to order comment in New Issue View

fields.description:
Non-admin users with no permission for *Administer Jira* from *Global Permissions* is getting the following screen when clicking on *Default Screen* hyperlink from *Issue layout*(project settings) page
 !defscreen.png|thumbnail! 
As the page is only showing correctly for users granted with *Administer Jira* from *Global Permissions*, the page should shows a more meaningful error message for user that do not have access to it

e.g 
{quote}
You do not have sufficient permission to view this page. Please contact your administrator or contact support.
{quote}
fields.summary: Improved the error message for non-Jira admin user when click on Default Screen hyperlink on Issue layout page from project settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Old issue view removes the issue key reference at the URL if you add a \ at the URL.
This causes when editing the issue, the page to spin forever.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Disable new issue view at the User Profile Settings (Jira Labs)
# Load any issue page and add a \ at the end of the URL

h3. Expected Results
The page should load without any problem and keep the issue key at the URL

h3. Actual Results
The issue key is removed from the URL and the issue cannot be edited anymore

h3. Workaround
Enable the new issue view. (toggle Jira Labs on)
fields.summary: Old issue view removes the issue key reference at the URL if you add a \ at the URL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users run REST call to /rest/api/2/status, some statutes are not translated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Run the following:
{noformat}
 curl -X GET --user <email>:<token> --url https://<URL>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/status -H "Accept-Language: sv-SE" 
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

Statuses are translated
h3. Actual Results

Statuses are not translated
h3. Notes

It only affects some statuses
{noformat}
Status id = 3, name = "Pågående"
StatusCategory id = 4, name = "Pågående"
(correct)
Status id = 10000, name = "To Do"
StatusCategory id = 2, name = "Att göra"
(wrong, "To Do" is not a correct Swedish translation)
Status id = 10001, name = "Done"
StatusCategory id = 3, name = "Klart"
(wrong, "Done" is not a correct Swedish translation)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Some statuses are not translated for /rest/api/2/status

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Randomly some issues in the recently worked on page for a users profile are not directing to the correct site location. {{https://<SITE_NAME>.atlassian.net/jira/people/<AA_ID/work}}

Instead of being directed to {{https://<SITE_NAME>.atlassian.net/browse/<ISSUE_KEY>}} the user is directed to {{https://api-private.atlassian.com/browse/<ISSUE_KEY>}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*We have not been able to reliably replicate or find the exact circumstance that causes this to happen.*


h3. Expected Results
All issues listed on {{https://<SITE_NAME>.atlassian.net/jira/people/<AA_ID/work}} direct to the correct URL {{https://<SITE_NAME>.atlassian.net/browse/<ISSUE_KEY>}}.

h3. Actual Results
Some, (in most cases one or two) issues listed on this page direct the user to {{https://api-private.atlassian.com/browse/<ISSUE_KEY>}} resulting in a 404 error.
 
h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Some issues in users recently worked on issues in their profile direct to incorrect URL resulting in 404

fields.description:
It is very useful for IT admins to have transaction logs in Jira.

This helps with identifying who performed a certain task, e.g uploading files with important information. In addition, it is also important to provide detailed information to the legal team when they need evidence in company litigation events.

An example of what it could look like:
User A downloaded file (XX_TEXT.pptx) on yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm:ss and source ip address is x.x.x.x.
fields.summary: Provide transaction logs in Jira Audit log

fields.description:
Since all different email services like Gmail, O365 build and construct emails in a different way, therefore, currently how the email is processed in Jira is different. For example, when Outlook sends an email with multiple addresses in the *To* list to Jira service desk email channel (each address is for the support channel in a different project), it will send it as one message with multiple envelope recipient addresses (RCPT TO in the SMTP session). Whereas, Gmail, on the other hand, would send a separate email for each recipient.

Therefore, for the email sent by Outlook, only one ticket is created in the project which is listed first in the *To* list (rest are ignored), whereas, in Gmail's case, two separate tickets are created in the respective projects.

This feature request is to improve this behavior and bring uniformity to how Jira processes incoming emails.
fields.summary: Uniform behavior in handling emails from different servers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding an image to a comment, if the save button is clicked multiple times before the upload is complete, multiple comments are added

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: upload an image inside a comment in the new issue view
 # Step 2: click "save" multiple times before the file has been completely uploaded

h3. Expected Results
Only one comment is posted

h3. Actual Results
Multiple comments are posted


h3. Workaround
Wait for the file to be completely uploaded before clicking the "Save" button
fields.summary: When adding an image to a comment, if the save button is clicked multiple times before the upload is complete, multiple comments are added

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using *maxResults* parameter in search user REST API does not extend the results to more than 100 users. The default is 50 and *maxResults* works for up to 1000 results.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have more than 100 users in the instance
 # Run the following cURL command:
{code:java}
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user/search?username=&startAt=0&maxResults=1000' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <access_token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json'
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Get more than 100 users
h3. Actual Results

Only the first 100 users are returned.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no workaround for this. We update the ticket once we have more information.
fields.summary: Search user REST API (/rest/api/3/user/search) does not return more than 100 users

fields.description:
. h3. Issue Summary

When using the old issue view, the drop-down moves with the page when you scroll it

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Disable the new issue view
# Add a long description to an issue to be able to scroll the page
# Open a drop-down select option field, like "Epic Link"
# Scroll the page

h3. Expected Results

The options remain under the field

h3. Actual Results

The drop-down moves with the page

 !select_field_bug.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Since this problem affects only the old issue view, users can use the new issue view as a workaround. To do this, please follow the steps below:

# Click the user avatar on the bottom-left of the screen and click on *Settings*
# Under *Jira labs*, next to *New Jira issue view*, click the grey button to enable the feature (it will become green)
fields.summary: When using the old issue view, the drop-down moves with the page when you scroll it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When assigning an issue, Jira is unable to search for the user from the user picker list using email address if the user's display name is in Russian

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user with a display name in Russian
 # Try to assign the user by searching the user's email address 
 !r-bug3.JPG|thumbnail! 
 !r-bug1.JPG|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results
The user will be listed in the search list from the dropdown

h3. Actual Results
No result showed 
This behavior does not affect when trying to set the reporter while editing the issue

h3. Workaround
Search the user using their display name 
 !r-bug2.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to search assignee from user picker list using email address if the user's display name in Russian

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Workload Pie Chart* gadget will group certain estimates under an "Other" pie slice if there are many values being tracked from the *Statistic Type*.

It seems to be using a logic to group these statistics and is grouping the values that are below 70.1% of the average on the chart.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add a *Workload Pie Chart* gadget to a Dashboard
# Use "Labels" for *Statisc Type*
# Use "Current Estimate" for *Time field to report on*
# Add 30 labels on a test Issue and adjust the *Original Estimate* to 1000h
# On another test Issue, add a new label are adjust the *Original Estimate* to 700h or under


h3. Expected Results

The pie chart is expected to show a slice and its value for every label. Here, the label "SFF" has its own slice because it has 800h.

 !Public_Dashboard_-_SFF.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The label on the Issue with 700h will be grouped with "Other". The same "SFF" is being grouped with "Other" now because the value is 700h now.

 !Public_Dashboard_-_other.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

There is no known workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: Workload Pie Chart groups estimates with Other

fields.description:
Resolution field only appears when there is a value other than unresolved in new issue view.
In Old issue view, the resolution filed shows unresolved.
fields.summary: New issue view should include the same features as the old one.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to rename the *Create* transition in any workflow, to any language characters, it throws this error

 !Screen Shot 2019-10-28 at 4.57.01 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any workflow in *Edit* mode.
# Select *Create* transition.
# Click on *Edit* button.
# Provide a different name for the transition.

h3. Expected Results
* The transition renames successfully.

h3. Actual Results
* The transition doesn't rename, an error is thrown.

 !Screen Shot 2019-10-28 at 4.57.01 PM.png|thumbnail! 

The above error is thrown on the UI.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Renaming the Create transition gives HTTP 500 error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Regression of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33116

If the email sender has a disabled user in the instance (usually a JSD portal only account), the Jira Core mail handler will fail to process the message, as it will match the disabled user instead.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira Service Desk portal only account: Jira Service Desk Project > Customers > Invite customers.
 # Access the user administration panel and migrate the user to "Atlassian Account".
 # Make sure to provide the user with permissions/access to a Jira project.
 # Send an email to a Jira Core handler, in order to create an issue/comment

h3. Expected Results

The issue/comment is successfully created
h3. Actual Results

The email will not be processed. The following appears in Jira logs:
{code:java}
 message: Reporter is found but inactive{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Mail handler incorrectly matches inactive users when processing emails

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
Allow receiving an automatic weekly report from Jira with the following data for each user (employee):
1. List of closed tasks during reporting period;
2. Hours spent on each task
3. Evaluation of each task
4. Lead time of each task (calendary days)
5. how many hours were tracked during reporting period
6. how many hours were tracked by tasks which were marked as done
fields.summary: Allow receiving an automatic weekly report from Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Bulk Operation produces a 404 error page for users who are without Bulk Change global permission. 

The user is able to go through all the Bulk Operation steps until the end but not able to proceed further through the final step and encounter a 404 error page. Hence, the Bulk Operation is not carried out in the end.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Access an epic of a project
# Next to *Child issues*, click *more(...) > Bulk edit*
# Select *Edit Issues*
# Select *Change Priority* and click *Next*
# Click *Confirm*

h3. Expected Results

The user is notified that they don't have permission to perform bulk operations

h3. Actual Results

A 404 error message is displayed

 !Screen Shot 2019-10-25 at 8.39.15 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Grant the "Make bulk changes" to the affected users. To do it, please follow the steps described below (only Jira administrators can perform the steps below):

# From the Jira home page, click *Jira settings > System > Global permissions*
# At the bottom of the screen, select *Make bulk changes* on the *Grant* field and select the most appropriate user group in the *Group* field
# Click *Add*
fields.summary: Bulk Operation produces 404 error page for users without Bulk Change global permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A recent change in JIRA re-allowed the *Administer JIRA* permission to be edited from the global permission page. Previously, site-admins could only add groups to this permission through the *Product Access* section of site-admin and that's the expected behavior.

Because of this change when groups are added through the Global permissions page they will be removed at some point since the source of truth to that permission is still the Product Access settings.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access the global permissions page of your instance(https://instance.net/secure/admin/GlobalPermissions!default.jspa)
 # Add a new group to the *Administer JIRA* permission.

h3. Expected Results

The user should see a message on this page guiding him to add groups to that permission through the Product Acces page.

h3. Actual Results

Once the group is added it will be removed at some point when the application identifies the inconsistency.

h3. Workaround

Add groups to the permission through the Product Access page.
fields.summary: The administer JIRA Global permission is editable through the global permissions page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Post function "copy value from other field" does not work on the *create transition* for Assignee field (Inheriting the value from the parent issue to a sub-task)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to your project settings > Workflows > Find the workflow related to sub-task issue type >Edit > Click on the create transition > Post functions
 # Configure the Post function "copy value from other field", copying the assignee field from parent to the sub-task:                        !Screen Shot 2019-10-25 at 17.50.10.png|width=438,height=139!
 # Save the workflow draft
 # Create a sub-task in an assigned issue

h3. Expected Results

when creating a sub-task, the Assignee of the parent is copied to the sub-task.
h3. Actual Results

The assignee is not set.
h3. Workaround

None at this moment.
fields.summary: Post function "copy value from other field" does not work on create transition for Assignee field

fields.description: An option to add up all of the time/work logged in an epic should be available in Jira.
fields.summary: Ability to add up all work logged in an epic

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Right now, it is not possible to use *history searches* such as *changed* for text or description fields.

h3. Current Results
{code}description changed BEFORE startOfWeek(){code}
(x) History searches do not support the 'description' field.
fields.summary: Allow JQL searches for changes in Description field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In order to be able to share filters, it is necessary to have the *Share dashboards and filters* global permission.

When viewing a filter while without such permission, you simply won't see the button to share the filter:
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-25 at 15.12.19.png|thumbnail! 

That may cause some trouble for the user, as they will not know how to proceed.

h3. Suggestion

Display a warn to the user so they now if they need to reach an admin to ask for such permission.
fields.summary: Warn users if they do not have permission to share filters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It was identified that Jira has its own timezone settings in the user profile and it doesn't sync with the Atlassian account timezone. This can be a problem when users use Atlassian Access because in Jira it will be possible to have the user's timezone configuration differently from the AD timezone configuration, for example.

h3. Suggested Solution

Jira has to sync the timezone configuration from the Atlassian account.
fields.summary: As a Jira administrator, I want Jira to synchronize the user timezone with the Atlassian account timezone

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the New Issue View, the new options are not displayed in the correct order of a dropdown custom field.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dropdown field
 # Add a new option to the custom field and put it in the middle of the order

h3. Expected Results

In both views, Old and New and the order should be displayed the same.
h3. Actual Results

In the New Issue View, it's showing in the order of creation and not the one set in the field configuration.

[^Bug Dropdown.mp4]

This also affects mobile versions.
 
h3. Workaround

The only workaround would be to use the Old Issue View.
fields.summary: Dropdown is not Displaying Options Correctly on the New Issue View
